text: Quick one guys, Just wondering how many of you guys build clients websites in HTML and the add the HubL code in for the modules or do you build it all in the modules?
We use the design manager when ever possible. Solves for the client beyond our relationship
Hey I used to create custom module to build a template :slightly_smiling_face:

Due to client “wants” almost all of the HS sites I build I build drag n drop, I built a framework we use internally for drag n drop templates, now I prefer drag n drop because I can just add class names to modules/groups in the drag n drop and get a site 80% of the way. I haven’t done it just yet, but I plan to one day build a whole html email template as a custom module - I want to have control of the html and let the marketers have a basic flex column like system in the emails.
I do use coded templates for some more complex stuff, like routing in different drag n drop templates based on query parameters. It’s just not common
We almost exclusively build in Coded templates with interface elements / settings exposed via custom modules / tags in the Blog Post / Landing Page / Website page Edit view.

It's easier for our flow to have the (mostly non-HubSpot/Hubl) developers build out the HTML/CSS/JS in their flows and have our internal "integration" team make the code dynamic and function properly within HubSpot as re-usable "chunks" and "modules"

not sure I’m fully understanding your question but maybe this will answer it:

If you went this method, all clicks to the CTA would look like they were going to the “routing page”. You would not know which page/site people were redirected to.

You theoretically would see in the referrers for the page the user actually ends up on, the routing page.

If you need to track those analytics it’s probably worthwhile looking for a tool like this out there. It’s such a simple idea, I’m certain there’s a service that does it.
We build everything into custom modules so that we can pull them into multiple templates easily and every custom module has its own scss partial.
oh, you’re asking where that text is coming from?

“MAKE THIS DYNAMIC VIA JAVSCRIPT” is in the meta description of the page settings. It has been replaced with “Place | Property For Sale” in the latest version, but that version has not been published yet.
Is anyone else having trouble with HubSpot FTP today? I can connect, but it's not uploading any of my files
I've used it plenty of times before and it's usually fine
Are there any issues with hosting today? I've noticed both websites hosted on HubSpot and just moving around inside HubSpot portals, things are loading slowly.
Not seeing that issue personally. HS Status doesn’t seem to mention it <https://status.HubSpot.com/>
I was seeing login issues and stylesheet wonkiness earlier, but all appears normal now
Thanks for the pointer on that. Good catch! It would be mighty great if I could have explicit control of those tags please...
Yep, that confirms my approach! Thank you, will look to using the CTA's to track the click but pass out to analytics for the context.
